topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 1.1: Bootstrapping the HP Helion Lifecycle Management Virtual Machine and Installation Services

body.p: The first phase of the HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade installation involves creating a bootstrapping the HP Helion Lifecycle Management virtual machine and installation services.
The installation uses Ansible playbooks, which are files that contain scripts that execute required installation processes.

section.title: Prepare the system for deployment
section.p: Use the following steps to prepare the server on which the HLM VM will be deployed (the HLM host):

ol.li: Log into the HLM host using the default credentials

Edit the /root/infra-ansible-playbooks/group_vars/all file for your environment. For information on each variable, refer to the comments in the file with each variable.
The group_vars/all file should appear similar to the following for a KVM + ESX deployment: ############################################# Variables for HLM ################################################################# #These variables are relevant in both All Virtual and BareMetal scenarios.
#Set this to 1 if you will not deploy a dcn cloud via this HLM node and will deploy only ovs cloud ovs_cloud_only: 0
#Set this to 'bm' if cloud is being deployed over baremetal. #Set this to 'av' if the cloud is all virtual cloud_type: 'bm'
#These are hlm related variables that must be changed according to your Baremetal Env hlm_login_id: root hlm_password: cghelion
#The following variables are for CLM network IP details for HLM hlm_clmstaticip: 10.20.x.x hlm_clmnetmask: 255.255.255.0 hlm_clmgateway: 10.20.x.x
#The variables starting with cobbler_ are inputs that are usually given to initcobbler.sh. Set accordingly. cobbler_pxestartip: 10.20.x.x cobbler_pxeendip: 10.20.x.x cobbler_pxestaticip: 10.20.x.x cobbler_pxenetmask: 255.255.255.0
#Set the location of your images that will be used by libvirt imagelocation: /var/lib/libvirt/images
#Set the location of your infra-ansible-playbooks ansible_dir: ~/infra-ansible-playbooks
Check the /root/infra-ansible-playbooks/hosts file to enter the IP address of the vibr0 interface in the hlm_kvm_host field, as shown in the following example.

section.title: Deploy the HLM Virtual Machine
section.p: Use the following steps on the HLM host to deploy the HLM VM on the HLM Host using Ansible playbooks.

ol.li:
Execute the following command: ansible-playbook -i hosts setup_hlm_onBM.yml
Sample Ansible Playbook run output

Locate the IP address for the HLM VM in the /root/infra-ansible-playbooks/group_vars/all file of the HLM host under hlm_clmstaticip field. You will use this IP address to SSH into the HLM VM during the HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade installation process.

section.title: Disabling the root user
section.p: For security purposes, we strongly recommend disabling root. After the root user is disabled, you can use another default user account, cghelion to access the HLM VM and any actions that require root access should be done using sudo.
Execute the following command to run a script that disables the root user.
This command will disable the root user and performs the following tasks:

ul.li: removes password for root from the /etc/shadow file
removes any and all keys in /root/.ssh/authorized_keys file
changes PermitRootLogin in /etc/ssh/sshd_config file from "yes" back to default of "without-password"
restarts the ssh service so the above config change takes effect immediately

section.p: Once this command complete, the cghelion user should be used .

section.title: Next Step
section.p: The next step depends upon the HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade deployment model you are installoing: KVM or KVM + ESX. For more information on each deployment model, see KVM deployment
